main event: Multiple bright red or orange colored objects were observed to climb into clouds and make abrupt changes in course near Yuma, Arizona on April 27, 1952.
interesting points: The objects were described as bright red or orange in color, slightly larger than the planet Venus.
The objects were observed to make erratic and abrupt changes in course, with one object pulling up rapidly into the overcast clouds.
Two objects were sometimes seen at the same time, and the objects disappeared out of sight in the distance.
The observer was a USAF 3/Sgt who was Chief of AC&W Operations, with prior experience in airport control work and as a mechanic.
Multiple people in the Yuma area observed the objects, which were sighted between 8:30 pm and 11:30 pm.
sighted object: Bright red or orange colored objects
witnesses: USAF 3/Sgt and other observers in the Yuma area
photographs: No, the report does not mention any photographs.
